column4: How can I list all network computers in command line? I have one Ubuntu machine but it's not shown on the network window, there's only Windows network. I can still connect to that computer with IP address.
smbclient -L <ip>/host
It would be nice just connect to that computer by name
ok thanks
apt-cache search samba (there's smbtree and smbclient)
there's even gui ones ..
Ok
what do u mean your ubuntu machine not being shown on the network window? (trying to use nmbd ?)
When navigating to Places-Network
that computer is not listed there
That computer has this irssi which I'm using right now, so I can connect to that computer with IP, no probs
u can use the nmbd daemon (this is part of the samba package)
just wondering that should it be listed there
use swat.. it's easier to set things up.. (apt-get install swat)
Okay
yeah
then url:localhost:601 if i'm correct or its another port (u use firefox)
have to try those things
it's port 901..
ok thanks
so once swat is started.. u can do http://localhost:901 .. it not then http://127.0.0.1:901
